pr_title: Adds support for microsecond timestamp precision

timeline.author: bhhari
bhhari

replies.bodyText: I wanted to materialize nanosecondsPerTimeUnit/timestampUnitsPerSecond in ctor to avoid multiple virtual function calls on critical path (ApacheHiveTimestampDecoder#decodeTimestamp). Do you think it's ok?
replies.author: borovsky-d

timeline.author: bhhari

timeline.message: Adds support for microsecond timestamp precision

timeline.bodyText:
It looks like there are only 2 possible values for timestampTimeUnit: MILLISECONDS and MICROSECONDS. Perhaps, add a check that this is so and also consider using a boolean to distinguish between the two possibilities.
nit: timestampTimeUnit -> timeUnit since class name includes "timestamp"
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: ok, using boolean flag instead of time unit
replies.author: borovsky-d

timeline.bodyText: This error message seems too cryptic. Wouldn't it be enough to assert that timestampTimeUnit is either MILLI or MICROSECONDS?
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: I'm using boolean flag instead of time unit, so non relevant anymore.
replies.author: borovsky-d

timeline.bodyText: Why is this particular date? A comment is needed. Using TimeUnit instead of / MILLIS_PER_SECOND
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: I didn't change it from original code https://github.com/prestodb/presto/blob/master/presto-orc/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/orc/reader/TimestampBatchStreamReader.java#L81 but let me add comment to improve it
replies.author: borovsky-d

timeline.author: mbasmanova
mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: nit: getBaseTimestampInSeconds -> getBaseSeconds + comment explaining what this is
timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText:
nit: message is missing
this.timestampTimeUnit = requireNonNull(timestampTimeUnit, "timestampTimeUnit is null");
